platform.game

Interface World

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Simulator

    public interface World
    Represents an environment populated by actors.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Vector defaultCenter
      Default center of the View.
      static double defaultRadius
      Default radius of the View.
      static java.lang.String pathSave
      Path to the folder containing all save folders.
      static java.lang.String pathWorld

    • Field Detail

      • defaultCenter

        static final Vector defaultCenter
        Default center of the View.

      • defaultRadius

        static final double defaultRadius
        Default radius of the View.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • pathSave

        static final java.lang.String pathSave
        Path to the folder containing all save folders. Path to the files in the save folder, number and "/" to add.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • pathWorld

        static final java.lang.String pathWorld
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getLoader

        Loader getLoader()
        Returns:
        associated loader, not null

      • setView

        void setView(Vector center,
             double radius)
        Set viewport location and size.
        Parameters:
        center - viewport center, not null
        radius - viewport radius, positive

      • getCenter

        Vector getCenter()
        Returns:
        expected center of the World
        See Also:
        Button

      • getRadius

        double getRadius()
        Returns:
        expected radius of the World
        See Also:
        Button

      • register

        void register(Actor actor)
        Adds the actor to the registered/unregistered arrays of the World.
        Parameters:
        actor - an Actor

      • unregister

        void unregister(Actor actor)

      • nextLevel

        void nextLevel()
        Tells to the World to load the next level. Code is handled in update.

      • setNextLevel

        void setNextLevel(Level level)
        Sets the level to be loaded if nextLevel() is called.
        Parameters:
        level - a Level
        See Also:
        Simulator

      • hurt

        int hurt(Box area,
         Actor instigator,
         Damage type,
         double amount,
         Vector location)
        Sets a "hurting zone" in the World. Each actor entering this zone will be hurt by the Damage type.
        Parameters:
        area - it is the Box delimiting the zone
        instigator - the Actor instigating the Damage
        type - indicates which type of Damage is dealt
        amount - the amount (double) of damage dealt by the "attack"
        location - indicates where it comes from (Vector)
        Returns:
        the number (int) of "victims", aka Actors influenced by the attack

      • getGravity

        Vector getGravity()
        Returns:
        the gravity (Vector) in effect in the World.

      • getGravityAngle

        double getGravityAngle()
        Returns:
        the angle between 0 and 2*PI, 0 representing the usual gravity (downwards pointing)

      • setGravity

        void setGravity(double angle)
        Sets a new angle to the gravity.
        Parameters:
        angle - in radians (double)
        See Also:
        Player, which is using an instance of..., Overlay, displaying an instance of..., SelecteGravity, that can change the angle of the gravity.

      • link

        void link(Linkable linkable)
        Asks the simulator to "link" a Linkable to different Signals.
        Parameters:
        linkable - Actor (which must be Linkable) with which we desire to link some Signals.

      • saveAll

        void saveAll()
        Used to call save() in Simulator. Circumvents the fact that the call would be issued in update itself...

      • load

        void load(int world)
        Uses the Serialized data created by save() to load a brand new level. Part of the code was inspired by the one described on the mentioned website:
        Parameters:
        world - Indicates which save is to be loaded (from 1 to 999)
        See Also:
        Source website
